channel.title: Bit By Bit
channel.description: Recent content on Bit By Bit

item.title: We are your package maintainers, and we are here to help
item.description: So, I was on my computer, doing normal computer stuff. Suddenly, a new window reared its head. Whew! It was the Ubuntu Software Updater, here to bring security patches, and vetted, cryptographically signed patches from upstream. Yay! I had nothing to fear. Or so it would seem. Being curious, I start poking around. Not long after, I was confronted with this: Sorry, security people, I should have tagged this post Not Safe Or Secure.

video game magazines computer shopper https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Equipment_Corporation gatekeeper.dec.com funet.fi sunet.se dial-up kermit BBS PPC: The first of Apple’s two system software miracles culture memes cobalt will you love cobalt? tunak ccomics
This computer was affectionaly dubbed the CoCo by its adherents elsewhere, but I didn’t learn this until much later, as I was living in a small isolated town. COW ascii movies

Loko at the coco char set ascii note that break is 0x03 microsoft malloc debug fill string handling in this basic was better than what we get in the cc standard library by Bill G https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_BASIC it wouldn’t be the first time I would encounter ms sw code: Needing to be fast / small ultima 9 coco roms: http://www.trs-80.org/interview-jack-crenshaw/ li chen wang bill gates turbo pascal split program trupet winsock
